newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft shares sag.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft shares sag.

text.p: Shares in Microsoft Corp dropped more than five points in after-hours trade Thursay after the company posted fourth quarter earnings a penny above ananlysts' expectations, traders said.
The company traded at 143-3/4 after the bell, down from an unofficial close of 149-1/2. The shrinking stock price was attributed to results coming in below traders' "whisper numbers," a dealer said.
The software company posted fourth quarter results for the period ended June 30 of $0.80 per share, a penny above a First Call consensus estimate of $0.79 per share.
Iomega Corp, on the other hand, saw its stock price pick up more than a point after it released second-quarter earnings of $0.19 per share, compared with $0.11 per share for the year-ago period.
Traders said the computer storage product company traded at 23 after the U.S. market close, up from 21-7/8.
Sun Microsystems Inc, which dipped to 44-3/4 shortly after the close of regular-hours trading, eventually rose to 45-3/4 in after-hours trade. The software company closed at an unofficial 45-9/16.

Also in the technology industry, Dell Computer dropped more than a point after the bell. The company announced earlier in the afternoon that it had reduced U.S. prices by up to 16 percent for its corporate OptiPlex desktop personal computers.
Traders said Dell traded at 147-1/4 during a very active after-hours session, down from an unofficial close of 148-3/4.
"It was busy today," a trader said.

The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 168,700, above Wednesday's 112,600. The exchange said there was no activity during session two trading, compared with 6,850,000 the previous day.
